content.description: On the northwest side of Hornsby's, The Way It Is is the right route of the two bolted lines.  Climb through the bolts which are often closely spaced (two are a couple of feet apart).  Fixed anchors and a one rope rappel to get off.
content.protection: bolted route, fixed anchors at the top

content.description: On the northwest side of Hornsby's, Pestilence is the left route of the two bolted lines.  Climb through the bolts which are hard to pick out from the ground.  This route is well protected, but more runout then The Way It Is.  Fixed anchors and a one rope rappel to get off.
content.protection: bolted route, fixed anchors at the top

content.description: This rock blends in with a mass of rocks that are slightly separated from the rest of the Outlets.  They are across the Sunday Gulch trail to the west.  Two 5.9 bolted routes are on the northwest side of the rock.
